result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob B. NICHOLS

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.    
State moves to dismiss and read in this charge.   The defendant entered a plea in Case File 15 CF 697.    Motion granted.   
Minutes.
Scheduling conference on June 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea date on June 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 01-28-2016 at 2:00 p.m.
Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 01/28/2015, at 3:30 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 12-09-15 at 9:30 a.m.   
Minutes.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of escape.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 11-30-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $3,000.00 recognizance bond.  Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody serving a sentence and on a probation hold.
Minutes.
